website_summaries.verdict: Buyers wanting a lightweight  jacket with adequate weather protection should consider this hooded option.
pros: Jacket is packable for easy portability
Zippered hand pockets and elastic cuffs for supreme warmth
cons: Sleeves a little short for some

customer_reviews.title: the jacket fit like an XL though
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this jacket in a size XL I generally wear a size L. When I received the jacket it came with an XXL tag; the jacket fit like an L though! I know it sounds weird and confusing but if you wear a size L in t-shirts or L in jackets and coats place an order for an XL and it will fit like a L even though the coat may come in with a tag saying "XXL." I must say this jacket has a beautiful texture and it is very this, which you should already expect from a down jacket. I will be ordering the grey version of this jacket soon, I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KY

customer_reviews.title: Very good down jacket at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I wore this outside over a long sleeve tee shirt for over an hour at 32 degrees. I have a North Face an there is no difference. I would of given it 5 stars had the zipper been a little larger but, would highly recomend for the price. I'm 5'7" 165 lbs and the large fit just right.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket!
customer_reviews.text: What a great Jacket! My son wrore this jacket on a recent trip to Iceland. It did perfect keeping him warm from cold and wind especially. Such a great value for the cost! Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gooniegirl37

customer_reviews.title: Great Jacket for the price....
customer_reviews.text: Jacket fits really well. I am 6'2" 190lbs and have an athletic build and got the US medium/ XXL. I damaged my montbell down jacket and needed a down layer while i was having it repaired. This one was cheap and so i figured i couldnt go wrong. I have used the heck out of this jacket. I have summited some 14ers in colorado in this jacket and have been perfectly warm. I also wear this jacket casually to work and around town. Good buy. It does stink when you first get it but just wash it a couple times and it is good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer O.

customer_reviews.title: I do not know how this jacket has good reviews
customer_reviews.text: This jacket is not worth even $20. it is a cheap jacket and the pictures that you see here do not reflect how cheesy it is. I do not know how this jacket has good reviews, that was the reason I ordered it, do yourself a favor and put a bit more money and get something better, you can find other jackets for maybe $10 dollars more and they will be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're tall, this may not be for you
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband, and he's giving it 4 stars. It keeps him warm (we were out in android 32 degree weather the other morning and he stayed fairly warm with just a tshirt underneath, but we were also briskly walking). The only complaint he has so far is the arms are just a bit too shirt. For example, when he's sitting down and driving, the ends of the sleeves are about 3 inches above his wrist. Seems a tad too short in the waist, too. If you, or your man is one the taller side (mine is 6'1"), this may not be quite the right jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: The coat is good quality and nicely made. However, it runs REALLY small. I got the "Men's XL Tall" and it fits like a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda R.

customer_reviews.title: The jacket is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I followed the advice of other reviewers and purchased the XL. My son wears a L in most shirts and jackets. The XL fit him just right. My advice, order a size up. The jacket is great for the price. He work it up to Pike's Peak in CO yesterday, and said it was very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kaczynski

customer_reviews.title: Down backpacking jacket
customer_reviews.text: Order a size over what you wear....these a great for backpacking..they are made well....ultralight..super stuffable. I was Leary at first before ordering..read the reviews ..took a chance....totally glad I got this! I was not wanting to spend a couple hundred dollars for a backpacking puffy jacket...backpacking is pricey enough...this is a great deal.well made...works great.
customer_reviews.author: SteveW

customer_reviews.title: Overall?  Very impressed At this price point
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Fit, Finish, Quality on this down "sweater" Jacket mid weight by itself. Excellent as a base layer for sub 35f (if dry and low wind) Very versatile Price True to size in a large. 5'7" 155 lbs Quality and Packaging are impressive at this price point. Dislikes: Zippers The pocket zippers are usable but I probably won't use them. Concern of zipper fails. The main zipper is good, but this is not a "fast zipper". Again, could bind. Overall? Very impressed! To compare it as an extra to my Granite Gear, is a huge compliment. I will most probably "water guard this jacket."
customer_reviews.author: Jim_USATop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Could have been ok, but not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed on how thin it is, but I guess as a pack-able jacket, I shouldn't have thought it'd be thick. It does come with a bag to stuff in the jacket. The material is soft. It's very lightly filled with down, hence super light. Based on other reviews, I sized up to an XL but it was slightly too roomy (usual size is M), so I think the L would've fit better. I can't say whether it's warm or not since it wasn't tested outside. It looks like it could be a nice jacket but not what I was looking for because of the thinness and the fit so I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: It says it's a down jacket but according to the tag it's Shell: 100% Nylon Lining: 100% Insulation: 100% Polyester Fill: 80% Down / 20% Feathers I'm not quite sure how to read that. I have to say it's not particularly warm in high winds. And the small is bigger than I expected. The elastic waist and cuffs are pretty loose fitting and the hood has no way to tighten it down. This would be an okay $30 jacket, but at $50 is kind of disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer117

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I bought the non-hooded version of this a couple of years ago for backpacking. It was light but quite warm and pretty windproof and it packed super small. When I saw this hooded version, I immediately thought of getting it to replace the other one that I had used to death. This is just as good and I like that the hood keeps my head warm in windy conditions. I would recommend this as a buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgehiker

customer_reviews.title: Tested it outside and was not disappointed. At this price point
customer_reviews.text: Just got this jacket today. Tested it outside and was not disappointed. At this price point, what are you waiting for? Buy this jacket. I bought this jacket for backpacking but haven't gotten to use it yet. It comes with a small stuff sack about the size of a Nalgene bottle, if you wanted you could compress this down even smaller than that. I'm sure it's not as good as name brand jackets buy I don't think you can beat the price. For those wondering. I'm 6'3" 215lb with a lean muscular build. I got a XL and it's a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Needed a very light weight jacket that would pack small and keep me warm at night before crawling into my mummy bag. Worked like a dream last weekend in Olympic NP. I inpected every stitch and seam when it arrived. The quality is excellent. You can not beat the value!
customer_reviews.author: Bambooadam

customer_reviews.title: Superb Down Jacket! Not Waterproof, but Okay!
customer_reviews.text: This down jacket is all you need unless you want to spend $200+. The only thing you need is a rain jacket to wear over the top incase it rains. Water will absorb into this jacket which is the one preventable con. You spend $50 on this down jacket plus $50 on an outer rain jacket, now you're warm, dry & you saved $100+. Its super light weight and squishes down to the size of a softball for storage. You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: sivART

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for cold weather vacation. Was tried on but not zipped up prior to leaving. Nice jacket but the zipper is so difficult to start. Fits good on the top and middle but tight at the bottom making it hard to zip. Already worn so can't return. Probably give it to a needy family because hubby won't wear again. Disappointed I wasted my $.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Z.

customer_reviews.title: The jacket smells like goose, so I am pretty sure it is ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the X-large size, and it is too big for me. The jacket smells like goose, so I am pretty sure it is goose or duck down. It takes 2 washes to make the smell go away. Definitely do NOT wear it on a date, until you have a chance to wash it. The good news is I have washed and dried it twice, and they caused no harm to the jacket.
customer_reviews.author: pet2tso

customer_reviews.title: Warm but......
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for husband, 5’9” and 165lbs for a Large. It fit good and loose around the midsection. Pockets inside and outside were deep and really great! I removed 1 Star because it’s not waterproof and when you put it on in cold temps, it’s initially makes you colder! It also doesn’t dry well in the elements. If you plan on going out in less than 40°, add layers and a beanie.
customer_reviews.author: stonegyrl

customer_reviews.title: Smells foul, guess I had to find out for myself. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Item looks great, zipper is a bit wonky but it seems ok. I returned this item because like many others have said, it smells like a dead animal. I thought maybe it would be hit or miss and I would get lucky but the smell after just 10 minutes of having it out of the package and I immediately repacked it and sent for a return. Washing may help but I don't have the time to wash an item multiple times just to make it usable. My dog however loved the smell and wouldn't leave the package alone.
customer_reviews.author: Huntereich

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. First- it's very shiny fabric. He didn't like. Second it smells bad. Fit nice and quality good. Midweight Bought one size up to accommodate a couple layers below. So fit was just the way he wanted it. Smell however made us return.
customer_reviews.author: BeachRabbit

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong size; no drawstring for hood
customer_reviews.text: This was on my husband's Christmas wish list so I ordered it, but he ended up deciding to return it. First, we ordered an XL but received an XXL. He also realized the hood has no drawstring (a very important feature for a coat like this!) so he decided to look for a different brand/style that has that feature instead of sending back for the correct size.
customer_reviews.author: TeamMed

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR WINTER ACTIVITIES
customer_reviews.text: This "jacket" is pretty great if you want to stuff it in ur pack for emergency situations or in a school bag for ur kids for fall. It's by no means meant for hiking in the winter. You can totally take it in the fall if you don't expect to go lower then 50-55 but please don't hurt yourself trying to make this work as part of a winter activity setup. I ended up spending 80 more dollars to get myself an 800-fill Panta..... I don't want to sponsor.....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: On the whole, I am quite satisfied with this jacket. It does keep me warm in Northern California's winter months. Nevertheless, there are reasons for the jacket's low price. Compared to my small-sized Mountain Hardwear Nitrous jacket, the medium-sized ZSHOW jacket weighs less (11.35 oz versus 13.20 oz), has fewer baffles (14 versus 16) across larger area (26" versus 24" lengthwise), and has 20% feather filling. I can't be certain that the lighter weight is attributable to less down filling, but I suspect that's the case. Still, the ZSHOW jacket is good enough for casual wear.
customer_reviews.author: Samson Tu

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS COAT!
customer_reviews.text: I'd read all the reviews before I bought this coat so I already knew it ran a little small. So I ordered a men's large so I'd be able to wear it over a hoodie. It fits me perfectly. (I'm normally 42" on top.) I love how it compacts into a stuff sack when not in use. It's SO SOFT to the touch. It's a joy to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Rhia R. Drouillard

customer_reviews.title: Nice Jacket. Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: Jacket was exactly what I needed for a recent adventure and it fit the bill. Very lightweight. It actually looked good on me too! Can’t add much to what has already been written. I would recommend. I am 5’ 8” 145 pounds and the medium fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: KATmando

customer_reviews.title: Great customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: After fixing a mix-up with Amazon on the product offered, I was impressed by the customer service received from this manufacturer. They were very expeditious and corrected the error to my overwhelming satisfaction. The Jacket had the zipper on the left which is normally considered to be for females and it looks kinda purple under lights inside but outside light it looks blue, but it is very packable and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Get One Size Bigger/Warm
customer_reviews.text: Get one size bigger than you were. I’m 6’1 and 185 and I got the XL and it fits perfect. I used it this weekend on Mt Adams with 50mph wind and 37 degrees. I used it with a base layer and a wind coat for good measure but I felt great.! Light weight and very compact. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Rhetta

customer_reviews.title: Mildly misleading description
customer_reviews.text: Jacket was lighter than expected, and surface material was very thin and prone to tear. I would not recommend wearing this jacket below 45 degrees farenheit. No smell issue. Description is misleading but price was fair regardless. I'll save it for warmer days.
customer_reviews.author: Woodcement

customer_reviews.title: Good Coat - Too Light Weight for My Purposes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coat to keep warm as my wife and I were traveling to the Alps. For the price, it seems like a good coat. The coat seemed too light weight for my purposes. I returned the coat because I was concerned it would not be warm enough for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Guy

customer_reviews.title: Really REALLY warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a cheap hiking down coat and I love it. I wear this all around town and it is hands down the warmest coat I own and that's compared to some expensive name brand coats. It's super light and increadably warm likeT-shirt and coat in 20 degrees for over an hour warm. The only thing I dislike is the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Good jacket, but did not fit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought an L sized jacket based on the size specifications listed. It arrived in time and packed well. Pros: 1. Good quality - smooth feel 2. Light weight. It can be rolled and packed into a small pouch with comes along with it. 3. As its a hooded puffer (can be used while its snowing) Cons: 1. It did not fit me, was bigger. I had to return it the same day and order another size.
customer_reviews.author: MuRo

customer_reviews.title: Nice but the coat stunk so bad like wet dog.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the fit was good. Normally I'm a large, but with this we bought an extra large and it fit well. The main reason I give it one star is I wore it for 10 minutes and it smells like a wet dog. I thought it needed to air out and it would be fine, but no. It stunk so bad I couldn't wear it, sent it back for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dastrup

customer_reviews.title: Reviews of size were wrong
customer_reviews.text: I like the coat very much. It is super light weight but still very warm. Most of the reviews said the coat ran small. I found that to be wrong. I am a medium so I ordered a large and the large is a bit too big but I kept it anyway in case I want to wear a bulky sweater underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Color mismatch. I'll post pic later. I gave it to a friend.
customer_reviews.text: Color is all wrong. The blue is not Royal like in the picture, but sky or powder blue..really faded compared to photograph. Color Misrepresentation. I gave it away from frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Ts

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Didnt know what to expect buying this, for as light weight as it is, it is extremely warm. I purchased this to wear as a liner for a fishing trip, but it didnt get cold enough to use that way. Over all I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod A

customer_reviews.title: If it fits, a reasonable value.
customer_reviews.text: I can not select too large and small at the same time! The sleeves are SHORT! The body and hood run way too wide with no sinch cords. Based on other reviews I got an XL, I’m 6’, 200lb. The sleeves won’t cover my wrists with my arms at my sides and barely reaches my waist. It’s far too baggy, so if you aren’t layered it’s too loose. Probably 4/5 for quality, just fits horribly. I’m going to go spend the $100s on a good one like I should have to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Fionasmom

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5' 11" and 180 the Large is just right. I didn't want something that was too roomy but more form fitting. I wouldn't wear this in sub zero temps. either. It's not thick enough for 20 degrees but at 32 it was fine with a fleece vest under it. A little tight in the hips but not at the waste.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with Tommy Hilfiger packable jacket and kept this one, return Tommy. When I compared the quality with the price point, I felt this one was the winner for me. The medium size fits really well to me. I felt this one is designed for slender body type and perfect. I do see feathers coming out sometimes once or twice so far in a month of daily usage, I don't know if I should expect to be perfect with the money I paid for this. I doesn't bother me. Handles pretty well in cold as well. Very stylish and looks really good.
customer_reviews.author: Jayesh

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent coat.
customer_reviews.text: For the money. This is a great coat. If I have to buy another one, I’ll buy one that has a bit more down for more warmth. This one is great until then.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Fits and feels very good!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought it for my husband and he seems to like it!? Hasn’t wore it yet and didn’t check the waterproof part.., but fits and feels well.
customer_reviews.author: Izabela

customer_reviews.title: What a perfect Jacket, at a perfect price!
customer_reviews.text: Look no further.... this is the jacket for you!!! We are off to Iceland, and what is better than a winter jacket that fits into its own small pouch? This is going to be great for the weather in Iceland— the hood will come in really handy with the rain and wet weather! Thank you for making such a quality product at such a fair price! Laura Ann R-T, The Boulder Cookie Lady
customer_reviews.author: Laura A.

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jacket specifically for backpacking but since I got it I want to grab it every time it’s chilly outside. The more I wear it the more I love it! My only reason for giving 4 stars is they run a little small, meaning a large is really a medium imo and the down tries to poke out. When this happens don’t pull the down out, reach inside the jacket and try to pull it back in the jacket. But for 50 bucks this is a great deal
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight jacket
customer_reviews.text: The hooded jacket withstood the cold weather especially strong wind during my trip to Iceland. Impressed with the insulation from a lightweight jacket. Comfortable to wear and easy to carry in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cheaper alternative to more expensive ultralight dawn jacketsand am happy to report this fits the bill. Have used it in temps in 30’s and I have been comfortable. Hood elastic around face works great. Zipper is insulated.
customer_reviews.author: EJTV

customer_reviews.title: would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I purchased this. Wanted a lightweight down puffer for camping, and this meets my needs without breaking the bank. Note that the black has a slight brownish tint when held in the light. Doesn't bother me at all. No issues at all with this jacket. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Grand Poobah

customer_reviews.title: great jacket, sleeves slightly short
customer_reviews.text: great jacket, sleeves slightly short. Got it 2 days before I went to the Iditarod openings it started at -3 got up to 14 stayed very warm.
customer_reviews.author: shawn white

customer_reviews.title: It fits like a glove in Size Medium
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9 180lbs. It fits like a glove in Size Medium. My only grip would be that you can't really raise your arms above your shoulder because you will feel the seams under the armpit tighten. Quality is OK for a $50 jacket. Haven't tried in cold weather yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bird

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Really thin and all feather be on clothes when u take off coat
customer_reviews.author: babycakes

customer_reviews.title: Save yo MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. If you order navy u will get a purple jacket. Spend the extra money and get a nice patengia or arc’Teryx.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: it is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have puffs, but the price got me to purchase this one. It does the job. It is nice to have one that you take everywhere because it doesn't need to be carefully cared for because the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Brynna Cadman

customer_reviews.title: Great for Texas weather!
customer_reviews.text: Fits hubby great! He doesn't really like big coats, we live in Texas and it doesn't get that cold here. This is perfect for those chilly days 30/40's and a lot of wind, this is great. If you live in a region where you get hard winters, this may be too light.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Gal

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm but not bulky
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves the jacket and it looks good and is warm enough for Colorado winters. It is very soft to the touch and quiet and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Decerning

customer_reviews.title: Great coat!
customer_reviews.text: Great coat. Got the large for my 15 year old (he's 5'9" 140 pounds) and it fits great, a little roomy the way he wanted it. Looks just like the picture and it's warm and light weight. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: for the price this is a great jacket, went behind Iceland waterfalls kept me dry
customer_reviews.text: ICELAND IN SEPTEMBER: 40-50 degrees F. for the price this is a great jacket, went behind Iceland waterfalls kept me dry, good protection from cold wind, can be rolled up to a small pillow ball. Not exactly a custom fit but fits good. Was gonna buy a $200!plus north face jacket, no need! Well done random Chinese made Jacket lol
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Warm and light
customer_reviews.text: Its light and warm used in 15f and slight chill but was plenty warm as I got moving. It dose have a light smell though that took a week to dissipate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit as expected. Just a couple of negatives.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my jacket. I’m 5’10” and 170lbs. The large is a perfect fit. The only negatives for me are that the hood doesn’t have drawstrings to make a tighter seal for windy days. I’ll probably just add some Velcro. Also, the jacket is a bit shinier that I thought it would be. But not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Domrsim

customer_reviews.title: excellent jacket
customer_reviews.text: Great weight perfect fit. I'll wear it around town and even under my ski jacket(shell) on really cold days. It even has the zipper on the correct side. Don't get me started on supposedly men's jackets with a left zipper. I'm not about to start wearing women's clothes at my age.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warning do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This coat smelled so bad washed it twice and it still smells when u wear it outside I found out the down on the inside is bad and that's why it smells.. past time to return now I'm out 50$ DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Shacara

customer_reviews.title: Zippers fail quickly
customer_reviews.text: I loved this jacket which is everything I had hoped for: light and warm. The problem was that within a few months the zippers gave out, first the zippers in the pockets and then finally the main zipper. Having the jacket fitted with new zippers was more expensive than a new jacket. While an excellent deal price wise, I would not buy again unless they upgrade the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Sartorius

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Bought a medium but it was too large. I'm 5'9", 170lb w/ athletic build. Purchased a small, and even the small is a little baggy. Might try to taper it in on my own. Fit aside, the jacket is a great value. Incredibly lightweight, warm, and packable. With little to no wind, this jacket is comfortable to 12 degrees. With wind, comfortable at 30+. Keep in mind, this is fairly subjective and depends on your tolerance to cold.
customer_reviews.author: orodos

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Packable and lightweight. Keeps me warm and looks good. Took away some stars because I’ve only worn it about 5 times and there’s already a lot of wear/pilling under one arm. Not very well made obviously and looks like that spot won’t last much longer. Unfortunately I’ll be on the lookout for a replacement soon and I won’t be ordering this jacket again.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: great light weight jacket
customer_reviews.text: nice fit, construction seems to be great, and does a good job of sheading rain, wind, and cold....only thing i can mark down on is there is no hood draw string or velcro....other than that, i am very satisfied...add a draw string and you have a 5star.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The jacket is very light and could be folded to fit a small bag. It has less down than I expected. It is good for exercising in the winter and walking the dog at temperatures around 32 F (0 C). I am not sure if it will be warm enough in colder weather and at times not being active.
customer_reviews.author: David BenJoseph

customer_reviews.title: Everyday outerwear  for  unpredictable weather
customer_reviews.text: Great fit light weight jacket. Must needed jacket specially in the weather forecast jumping up and down with temperatures. You need a outerwear the go with either cold or slightly chill condition outside
customer_reviews.author: MarcAntony Jean

customer_reviews.title: Easy to wear
customer_reviews.text: Nice jacket. Light and foldable. Husband likes the way it wears. Not to thick but warm.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Color is way off!
customer_reviews.text: Jacket great. Reason I gave four stars is the light blue picture color is way off! It’s a baby blue not the color pictured. More of a women’s color. Kept cause I don’t want the hassle of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, not great
customer_reviews.text: The jacket fit fine. It was disappointing that there were no outside pockets and the zipper was really not adequate for that type of material. It tended to get jammed by the inside of the jacket. The hood needs a drawstring.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlover

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to it
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced for something that is little more than a windbreaker. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Raven

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: Cheap materials, it didn't last me all winter, it ripped after couple wears ,other than that it doesn't the job and it's a lighter weight.
customer_reviews.author: sunday

customer_reviews.title: But for light use or to wear for extra warmth in the sleeping bag at night it's amazing. Not ripstop fabric
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so for the money, you can not beat this deal! So it's not a high end expedition quality light weight down. But for light use or to wear for extra warmth in the sleeping bag at night it's amazing. Not ripstop fabric, but is a good liner under a shell.
customer_reviews.author: Keith G.

customer_reviews.title: Get This Super Amazing Puff Jacket Right Now.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome lightweight puffy jacket! i'm 5'11" 145 Pounds and got the Medium. Fits just right and is SUPER warm. I got this for bicycle camping setup for a more lightweight winter jacket, this keeps me even warmer than my more heavier Jackets and is more compact as well. Awesome Jacket! 5/5. Awesome Quality! 5/5. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Truthmemeguy

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and buy  nice jacket
customer_reviews.text: Edit: color on Black is off. Looks more brown in the sun but for the price is still good. Very warm and light Great jacket for the price. Will def buy another one. Bought a medium fits like a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: order one size larger
customer_reviews.text: My size is small but I ordered a medium size which just fits my body. The sleeves are just long enough. If I ordered a small size, the sleeve would be too short. It is wise to order one size larger. The jacket is thin. In order to keep warm in severe cold weather, it is better to put on another coat. It is good for temperature above 35F. But I have no complaint at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: Good but...
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of these "packables", this one's good looking but the Goose Down Fill was lighter than average, it could have use a little more feathers per cell or compartment, so this makes it a bit overpriced
customer_reviews.author: Da gnat

customer_reviews.title: Warm and light.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jacket for my son. It is warm and light. He wears it everyday. I think about to bay a different color. It is unusual for him to like his clothes as much.
customer_reviews.author: Dorota

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: My teen grandson wouldn't even consider a winter coat until his older cousin showed him this one of his. He allowed as how this was pretty cool, was light, and would fit into his backpack if not needed. We jumped on the Prime bandwagon and ordered it, and it's become his only coat. WIN!
customer_reviews.author: V. Beer

customer_reviews.title: and flattens out so very easy to pack (it comes with a little stuff pack
customer_reviews.text: Got a larger size based on other reviews and it is still a little small-ish but works. Immediately packed it for a trip to Europe where it came in very handy. It is warm, weighs almost nothing, and flattens out so very easy to pack (it comes with a little stuff pack, but it was easier to pack flattened out in one of those ziplock style packing bags for my purposes). Would recommend, especially for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: ABell

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat this price
customer_reviews.text: Very good jacket for its price! I’ll buy a few of these before I’d spend 200$ on a North Face. Has been from Yellowstone in the spring to Glacier in the fall and my almost permanent winter jacket in North Idaho.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Braniff

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Used on my climb of Mt Rainer. This gem worked just as well as my partners name brand jacket while on the mountain. Hood fit perfectly over my helmet and was very warm for a mid layer. Packs well too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this if you want to be warm!!
customer_reviews.text: This IS NOT a warm jacket!! Thinner than a sweatshirt.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This coat was of poor quality. The fabric was thin and there were many areas where light could be seen through the coat. Many areas had little or no feather fill. I felt like the coat would tear easily and the zippers did not operate smoothly. I returned this immediately because it would not keep my son warm on our Canadian Rockies camping trip. But the return process was easy to get started, dropped off at a Amazon return center near me, still waiting for refund.
customer_reviews.author: schoolisland

customer_reviews.title: Super wind proof coat!
customer_reviews.text: This coat is super warm. The best thing about it is the fact that it cuts out virtually all of the wind. I was very glad I brought this coat along to a funeral I had to attend. I stood outside in low 30 degree temperatures with a 25 mph steady wind with some gusts up to 35 mph for at least 45 minutes. This coat passed the test with flying colors in my book! Will definitely buy again if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: To thin
customer_reviews.text: It's to thin you will need to where another coat over or under it
customer_reviews.author: toni adams

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, fits great, keeps me warm
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my trip to NYC. Kept me warm on my trip. Only downside is dry clean only, but that's to be expected with a down jacket.
customer_reviews.author: G. Tomascheski

customer_reviews.title: Price to Value
customer_reviews.text: Unbeatable. I had to air it out for a few weeks, but it's acclimated nicely! Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley Salesguy

customer_reviews.title: Feathers Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit of this jacket however the feathers are coming out of the jacket everywhere I would expect that after some time and a few washing but not in the first couple of wears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thin and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Very thin and not what I was expecting . It’s very flimsy and I am not sure exactly how warm or dry it would keep you. A one season item for my son. If lost at school- no biggie!
customer_reviews.author: Marketa99

customer_reviews.title: Great for Backpacking!
customer_reviews.text: Love this jacket! Wish I'd gotten one sooner. Blocks the wind and I like how it folds down into it's own pack. Great for Backpacking. Would definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very good jacket - can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jacket for my husband. We were taking a trip to rainy Seattle, WA. This jacket was a great purchase - lightweight (very easy to pack), warm and kept him dry.
customer_reviews.author: Meesha PW

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and light jacket! It is a great jacket if you get the right size!
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice jacket but, I had to order pretty much 3 different sizes Before getting the right size. My brother is usually Small. So I bought Small but Instead, It fit me, I am size S-M woman. I think it was a mistake in the label because inside the tag's jacket says XS and tha paper tag to label price etc, says Small. When I bough the Large size both of the tags match. So at this point I just ordered Medium, hopeful that is the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Paola Collazos

customer_reviews.title: Thin
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like anything about the jacket Was so thin not why I expected Returned
customer_reviews.author: Mary Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Taking this with us on our Alaskan cruise. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Taking this with us on our Alaskan cruise. It fit as expected and it really is warm, but not heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Macmadam

customer_reviews.title: Superb!!
customer_reviews.text: It's very thin and lightweight, but you can feel the warmth within seconds of putting it on. Those lucky ducks! (Well, not anymore.)
customer_reviews.author: daveroller

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Overnight delivery helps when you need a new winter coat fast. Thank you. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Very small.
customer_reviews.text: Very thin, and very small. Ordered XXL, but should of ordered XXXXL. I gave it to my son, he wears a medium.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy61

customer_reviews.title: Great low cost, down coat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack-able down coat because of its light weight and packed size. When packed down inside the pack bag (that comes with it), the size is about the size of a soda can. It was perfect warmth for a 5o degree night at 10,000 feet elevation. I'm 6'0 feet tall, 200 lbs. I typically wear a Large, but i bought the XL and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Obscenely small. Ordered a Medium which no where on ...
customer_reviews.text: Obscenely small. Ordered a Medium which no where on the description does it say its a Medium in Japan. The US size listed on the tag was small, but it was closer to a kids size than an adult small.
customer_reviews.author: Christy R

customer_reviews.title: This runs 1 size smaller
customer_reviews.text: This is a very light and warm jacket . Just wish it was waterproof .
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Said could wash, but ruined jacket!!!
customer_reviews.text: washed jacket and all the feathers clumped up, I tried fluffing it but not luck, so jacket has round balls of feathers and other parts no feathers !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

product_meta.title: ZSHOW Men's Packable Down Jacket Hooded Lightweight Winter Coat
feature_bullets: Shell & Lining: 100% 20D*400T Nylon; Filling: 80% White Duck Down, 20% Feather
WARMTH: The winter jacket is insulated with good quality down feather padding, which accumulates heat quickly and locks in warmth, very soft and comfortable to wear
WINDPROOF: Hooded zip-front jacket keeps coldness out in winter days, comfortable elastic cuffs and hem effectively lock heat in and keep body warm
PACKABLE & LIGHTWEIGHT: This hooded down coat is good for easy travel and storage. The outerwear comes with a color-matched drawstring bag which can put the jacket in and take with conveniently
4 POCKETS - 2 deep internal pockets, great for little items like keys, wallet or phone and 2 external hand pockets. The side entry pockets have zippers to keep secure and warm
Best Use: Daily Wear or Casual & Outdoor activities,such as Ice Scating, Snowboarding, Traveling, Camping, Climbing, Cycling, Hiking, Running
